strIntroduction: Nikko, in Tochigi Prefecture, is the best destination to get away from Tokyo to know the other faces of Japan. Passing through the scenic countryside, this tour leads you to popular historic spots, such as Toshogu Shrine, Chuzenji Lake, and Kegon Falls. Just hop on a bus and enjoy strolling around the World Heritage Site! Itinerary: Pickup at select Tokyo hotels (07:30 – 09:00) Bus ride to Nikko (about 160 minutes) -Visit Nikko Toshogu Shrine, a mausoleum of 400 years old, deifying the founder of the Edo Shogunate, Tokugawa Ieyasu. There are 54 buildings decorated with pillars and vivid colors in the shrine. Keep in mind that 2016 is the year of the monkey. Do not miss watching the three wise monkeys at Shin-Kyusha that embodied the proverbial principle "see no evil, hear no evil, speak no evil". Lunch (*Please choose a tour with or without lunch when you make reservation.) -Visit Lake Chuzenji created by an eruption of Mt. Nantai, and relax by a beautiful scenery and a fresh air. -Visit Kegon Falls, ranked in the three great waterfalls in Japan. The area is full of fresh green leaves in early summer and red leaves in autumn. You can feel negative ions that a spray of water gives off from a 97 meter height. -Drop off at Shinjuku Station or Ginza (19:00 – 20:00) Tour Availability: Sun, Tue, Thu, & Fri from May to July 2016 this tour is provided by HIS
strTitle: Nikko and Kegon Falls World Heritage Bus Tour from Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Hydrospeeding (or riverboard) is a river sports in which you speed down a river on a small body board raft. This is a thrilling experience that really allows you to feel the power of the water. Don't worry if you are not a confident swimmer, you will be wearing fins, a life jacket, and a helmet which makes it easier to control your board and stay afloat. Our experienced guides will teach you & support you during the entire duration of the experience. This experience is available during riverboard season 4/19-10/25 The tour time is about 3 hours which includes getting ready, transport to river, rafting, and chill out time whilst checking out the photo's from the tour.
strTitle: Riverboard/Hydrospeed in the Tama River

strIntroduction: Ever dreamed of becoming a Bushido master (samurai)? Through this trip, you can meet a bushido master and learn life lessons from them. If you want to feel the spirit of Japan, this is the trip you are looking for. The dojo you are visiting is called "Ryuseikan" and it is very accessible from major cities in Tokyo (Shibuya, Shinjuku etc.) We will meet up at our office that is 10 minutes walk from Harajuku Station at 1:00 PM and move to the destination by car. Once we get to the temple, a bushido master will be your guide for the day. The number of participants is limited to 8 people, so hospitable service is ensured for each participant! There will be a translator to help you communicate so don't worry about a language barrier! You will spend around 3 to 4 hours at the dojo (Japanese training hall) doing different activities you've never experienced before. Details of the 4-hour bushido experience trip During this experience, you will: 1. First, prepare human-like decoys made of tatami straw that will be used as the opponent when practicing and fighting with a "katana," orJapanese sword. 2. Next, wet the straw decoy to symbolize the blood of a living opponent 3. Practice how to bow and move like a samurai 4. Use the wooden sword provided by the master to practice ‘kata,’ standard sword fighting posture 5. Advance to a metal, unsharpened sword to familiarize yourself with the feel of what it would be like to wield a real samurai sword 6. And, lastly, practice holding a real sword, face your wet straw opponent, and feel the sensation and power of your sword slicing through the air just like in movies! Not only that you can experience a Bushido lesson, you can also talk to locals and hear their life stories. After the trip, we will head back to Harajuku Station and finish the day.
strTitle: Spend half a day with a Bushido Master in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Sapporo city, the capital of Hokkaido, is one of the famous tourist spots in Japan - approximately 20 million of foreign visitors came to here in 2015. Most of the famous activities they enjoyed were generally shopping, visiting famous tourist spot, and having flesh Hokkaido cuisine. We would like to provide additional selection into Hokkaido tourism. That’s local Hokkaido experience! The itinerary is below: 10:00- we meet up at west side of north gate at Sapporo Station, or pick up at your hotel 10:30- arrive at the bottom of the mountain and begin hiking 12:00- lunch time, you can choose your favorite meal from several restaurant we have selected 14:00- we give you a ride to your hotel or Sapporo Station *This tour is held every Sunday during June 1st to September 30! 【3 courses you can select!】 ★Beginner’s Course (60 minutes walking) Climbing up to Okurayama (Okura Mountain). There are wooden steps, easy to climb up. On the top of Okurayama, you can grab a delicious ice cream for 350 yen. ★★Middle Course (80 minutes walking) Climbing up to Sankakuyama (Sankaku Mountain). Sankakuyama is higher and tougher than Okurayama. On the way to the top of the mountain, there are two ways, steep way and gentle slope. There are some dangerous spots that you should hands to grab a rock, but you can see beautiful view from the summit of Sankakuyama. ★★★Higher Course (180 minutes walking) Climbing two mountains, Sankakuyama and Okuayama! Both mountains are connected by a mountain trail. Enter from Sankakuyama, and climb up to the top. After that go to Okurayama. This course is the hardest and most dangerous in my tour, but this challenging experience must give you great sense of accomplishment. Please don’t worry! I support your safety as much as I can. ____________________________________________ FAQ: Q1: What if it will be rainy day? →Have a lamb barbecue (Genghis Khan BBQ) in Okurayama restaurant and enjoy view of Sapporo. Q2: How flexible is the tour? →Super flexible. As long as we can, we make suggestions for the best experience for your trip. If you want to do BBQ, we take you to the best park for BBQ, or if you want to go to seaside, we can take you to Otaru or Zenibako area. Q3: I’m alone. Can I join this tour? →Yes you can! From 1 person to 6 people can join this tour! Q4: How many guides are coming with us on this tour? →2 to 4 guides. It depends on the number of participants. All the guides are very friendly and good at English. If you have any questions, please feel free to ask us!
strTitle: Enjoy hiking and get great coffee at the summit of Sapporo!

strIntroduction: Why don't you wear a Kimono and have lunch at an old Japanese house, which was built 130 years ago? Maruyama-cho Wadatsumi is a reproduced building of Okiya, which was a house for entertainers to stand-by before their show. Although Shibuya is a city for young generation, once you step into Wadatsumi, it feels like you've transported to Edo period! Wear a Kimono at the venue and take photos at traditional Japanese building. For lunch, you can enjoy either mini sushi set or Japanese Wagyu beef while watching the fascinating view of the gorgeous garden. The photo shooting earns high satisfaction from the guests! There are special highlights only for this activity! 1) Choose your favorite Kimono! -When you enter the restaurant Wadatsumi, choose your favorite Kimono (or Yukata during June - September) which you would like to try it on. 2) Experience photo shooting and keep your memory! -You can experience photo shooting at the corridor so that you can keep it as an unforgettable memory. Photos will be given to you after the meal! 3) Enjoy delicious Japanese cuisine! -You can either select from Himenigiri, 24 kinds of mini Sushi lunch, or Japanese Wagyu Beef Hitsumabushi Gozen. 4) Purchase your favorite Kimono at valuable price! -If you really like your Kimono which you wore at the activity, you can even purchase them at valuable price, 5000 JPY! There are no other places where you can buy Kimono at this price! Wear a Kimono and experience lunch program in the Japanese atmosphere! Schedule: 13:00 - 13:45 Experience wearing Kimono 13:45 - 14:00 Photo Shooting 14:00 - 15:00 Enjoy your meal 15:00 - 15:15 Change your clothes 16:00 Take your Kimono Menu includes: -Himenigiri (Assorted Seasonal Sushi) or Wagyu Beef Hitsumabushi Gozen -Small Dish -Dessert This activity is available under following schedule: Open Days: Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday *This activity is unavailable on national holidays. Time: 13:00 - 15:15
strTitle: Enjoy Kimono Lunch at Hideaway Restaurant in Shibuya, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: From the ancient times human beings searched for water for their survival. Here in Japan, shaman women went to water for purification, rejuvenation and inspiration. In this 3-hour session, you will visit a sacred waterfall whose historical record goes back to more than a thousand years ago. Tapping into the tradition of water and sun rituals of Japan, you will be led to create your own ritual for your healing, rejuvenation and discovery based on traditional Japanese dance and the method of the Expressive Arts Therapy. Art supplies will be provided for this experience. Please wear comfortable clothing.
strTitle: Practice Spiritual Water Dance Healing in Kyoto

strIntroduction: If you are a true big fan of Japanese traditional art and culture, you definitely shouldn’t miss this incredible tour program! This tour program will take you to an Atelier in Asakusa, Tokyo, where you can enjoy experiencing the traditional Japanese dye methods for clothes. You can use several method for clothes dying, such as squeeze dyeing, wax drawing or templates dyeing to dye the clothes. Squeeze dyeing is the traditional and the intuitive dyeing technique that uses various tools and folded clothes. Wax drawing is a method that draws the patterns directly on clothes by using brushes and melted wax. Template dyeing is a technique that damps the template with exclusive paste made by natural ingredients. The flow of the clothes dyeing experience will be as follows: - Choose clothes that you want - Make your designs using rubber bands and marbles - Select the desired colors - Dye your clothes - Dry your clothes This tour program everyday except on Wednesdays from 10:00 - 19:00. You can try dyeing on towel, handkerchief, stole, t-shirt, lunch bag, tote bag, or Y-shirt. Please refer to the available course for pricing. Reservation is difficult to make, so we suggest you to use our reservation service to book with no hassles!
strTitle: Enjoy Dyeing Experience at an Atelier in Asakusa, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Takoyaki literally means "fried octopus," tako means octopus and yaki means fried and is a small ball-shaped Japanese dish made out of a wheat flour-based batter and cooked in a special moulded pan. Takoyaki tastes a little bit like Okonomiyaki in a ball shape but it has a much different flavor from the tako (octopus) cooked inside them. In most parts of Japan, people do not treat takoyaki as a meal. Many people typically think of takoyaki as something to buy from street vendors at festivals and events. In western Japan, in the Kansai area on the other hand, takoyaki is very popular not only as a snack but also as a meal. With this experience you can experience making takoyaki, an opportunity you cannot miss followed by the opportunity to eat the takoyaki you make. East Inc. offers a takoyaki making workshop in Fukuoka and the class is held just a 2 minute walk from JR/Subway Hakata Station and don’t worry, this class is suitable for complete beginners! If you do not like octopus, you can change it to other ingredients such as sausage, cheese, mochi or mentaiko. These are the activity details: Course: 90 minutes, Includes making and tasting 10 pieces of takoyaki. Reception hours: Every day 11:00 – /12:00 – /13:00 –
strTitle: Learn How to Make Takoyaki in Fukuoka!

strIntroduction: The wide Ise Bay south of Nagoya is encircled by Ise-Shima region on Mie prefecture's side and Atsumi peninsula on Aichi prefecture's side. In this pleasant day trip from Nagoya you will visit the wonderful Mikimoto Pearl Island and museum in Ise-Shima before crossing the bay by the gorgeous sightseeing cruise boat. You will arrive at Irago on Atsumi peninsula and have a delicious lunch followed by a hot spring and spa in a luxurious hotel with a panorama view over the bay. After this delightful experience you will be able to choose between returning back to Ise-Shima with the romantic sunset cruise or reaching Nagoya by taxi through Atsumi peninsula while stopping for seasonal fruit picking along the way. The options of this day trip make it possible for couples and families to participate by customizing the itinerary according to their needs. Enjoy one wonderful day around Ise Bay! Below is the itinerary for this trip. Option 1 is recommended for families with children, while Option 2 is recommended for couples: 7:00 am (recommended starting time) - leave Kintetsu Nagoya Station by limited express train and go to Toba Station (about 100 minutes) 9:00 am - visit Mikimoto Pearl Museum in Toba and learn more about the history of Japan's pearl cultivation which originated in the end of the 19th century. Nowadays the Mikimoto-branded pearls are world-famous and at the museum you can see a special performance of female divers Ama who still dive in the sea for oysters. 10:40 am or 10:50 pm - ride the Ise Bay ferry from Toba port, a few hundred meters south of the pearl museum. The pleasant sightseeing cruise takes about an hour to reach Irago on Atsumi peninsula. 12:00 - get picked up from Irago and go to Irago View Hotel, a luxurious accommodation facility where you will eat a gorgeous lunch and have relaxing time in the hot spring and spa center. The hot spring offers a commanding view over the bay! From this point you can choose between Option 1 and Option 2. Option 1: Meet your guide at the hotel and go by taxi to a rural farm in the middle of Atsumi peninsula. You can enjoy seasonal fruit picking: strawberries in winter and spring, and melons in summer! After that your taxi will take you to Toyohashi Station where the tour will end. Option 2: Return to Toba port by the sunset cruise of Ise Bay ferry (the time depends on the season). The tour ends at Toba Station. Note: This is a self-guided tour unless you choose Option 1. In that case there will be a guide for the second half of the day at Atsumi peninsula. Enjoy the beautiful nature and the wide ocean on this relaxing day trip to one of the most charming destinations in rural Japan!
strTitle: Cross the Ise Bay on a gorgeous cruise, day trip from Nagoya

strIntroduction: Nagano prefecture is widely known as the home of the Japanese Alps and the host of the Winter Olympics in 1998. This one day tour will take you to some of the highlights in the northern part of the prefecture. You can take the tour anytime, but the most scenic views you can see during the winter when the snowy landscape creates an unforgettable experience! Don't miss a chance to visit some of Japan's most famous mountain sightseeing spots! There are two types of group tour: starting from Tokyo (Shinkansen bullet train round-trip tickets included) and starting from Nagano (Shinkansen bullet train round-trip tickets not included). The schedule is the same for all types of tours. The one day tour's itinerary is as follows: 7:50- 8:30 - take Shinkansen from Tokyo Station (on your own for private tour and group tour starting from Nagano) 9:10 - 10:00 - arrive at Nagano Station and meet your guide 10:30 -12:00 - take a walk around Zenkoji Temple, the biggest and most famous temple in Nagano city, known for the first Buddhist statue in Japan. Zenkoji Temple is one of the oldest temples in Japan and is designated as a national treasure. 12:30 -13:30 - take a train to Yudanaka Onsen, a picturesque old hot spring town, from where you will take a 30-minute walking trail to Jigokudani Monkey Park 13:30 - 14:00 - arrive at Kanbayashi Onsenguchi near Yudanaka Onsen station and take a stroll to Jigokudani Monkey Park 14:00 -15:00 - enjoy the unique view of the monkeys bathing in a natural hot spring! In winter the entire pool is covered with snow and you will be amazed by the adorable faces of the soaking monkeys! 15:00 - 15:30 - take a walk back to Kanbayashi Onsenguchi 15:30 - 16:30 - take a train from Yudanaka Onsen back to Nagano Station 16:30 -17:30 - Take the Shinkansen from Nagano back to Tokyo. 18:30 -19:30 - Arrive back at Tokyo Station. If placing a last minute booking within 3 days of your visit, or if you do not provide us your hotel information at least 3 full business days prior your ticket date, you'll need to collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. - If your hotel reservation details change, please tell us immediately through the Voyagin dashboard. - We only deliver to hotels with a concierge with whom we can confirm the receipt of the ticket delivery. Ticket Pickup: If you are not staying at a hotel, book within 3 days of the ticket date, or prefer to pickup your tickets, you can collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. strIntroduction: Handa city in Aichi prefecture is famous for Japanese sake. The city is located near the Chubu International Airport. In this tour you will visit a Japanese traditional sake brewery, which takes 2 hours to see, and drink local sake. Meet at your hotel at 10:00 am Move to the sake brewery by train and taxi 11:00-12:00 visit sake brewery 12:00-1:00pm Lunch -----Optional tour----- Deepen your understanding and knowledge of Japanese sake. You can see the traditional tools used for sake brewing in the old days. Discover the valuable cultural heritage of the Japanese pioneers' traditional sake work. In this traditional plaster-wall warehouse sake brewing was performed for about 200 years until 1972. Special offer! Sake brewing experience on limited days! October 8th, 29th , November 12th December 3rd Between 12:30 pm-18:00 pm You will steam rice and work for the preparation of brewing sake from the finest rice. Included is also: Sake tasting, original label making, squeezing experience, bottle filling, eating soba (buckwheat noodles) and a souvenir (present): Pure rice brewed sake from the finest rice 720 ml. Only available on the selected dates above!
strTitle: Discover Japanese Sake Brewery near Nagoya

strIntroduction: The Yoshiwara quarter was established in Tokyo in the 17th century, and grew into a self-contained district offering all manners of entertainment. Among the women living within this quarter the oiran (courtesans) were the most prominent, chosen by the wealthiest and most powerful citizens as entertainers. Oiran were masters of entertainment, skilled in sado (tea ceremony), ikebana (flower arranging) and calligraphy, among other cultural arts. Experience a colorful representation of ancient Japan with this elaborate oiran show, ideal for both new and repeat visitors to Japan! - Performance Date Saturday & Sunday Only - Show Schedule Open 15:45, Show Starts 16:30 (30 min) Close 17:00 Duration: 1 hour Pick-up: Not available Inclusion: Show fee /Green tea (Cold)/Crackers Please do not arrive before the check-in time, as you will not be able to enter the theater. Please arrive at least 15 minutes before the show starts. Closest Train Station ・Oedo Line or Hibiya Line's Roppongi Station (Exit 3 or 5)
strTitle: See a Unique Oedo Oiran (Courtesan) Geisha Show

strIntroduction: The temple you are visiting is called "Honkouji" and it is around 1 hour drive from Tokyo. We will meet up in front of Hachiko statue at Shibuya station at 10:00 AM and move to the destination by train. Once we get to the temple, a monk will be your guide for the day. The number of participants is limited to 8 people, so hospitable service is ensured for each participant! There will be a translator to help you communicate so don't worry about a language barrier! You will spend around 3 to 4 hours at a temple doing different activities you've never experienced before. The activities include Japanese calligraphy making, matcha making. You also get to sit down and ask monks any questions you have! After the trip, we will head back to Harajuku Station and go back to Tokyo's city life.
strTitle: Spend half a day with a monk near Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Shodo is a type of traditional Japanese art style that uses brushes and ink to write "Kanji", or other Chinese characters. In the world of Shodo every single character has its own meaning and how you write the character expresses your feeling or your thought in what you write. In this lesson, you'll have the opportunity to create your own unique Japanese souvenir by writing your name in Kanji on a t-shirt, a Japanese fan, or another item of your choice. Don’t miss this opportunity if you want to experience real Japanese culture!! In this activity you will... • Learn about the background and history of Japanese Calligraphy. • Practice basic brush techniques and composition. • Learn how to write a letter(s) of your choice in Chinese characters ("Kanji") • Choose a souvenir type and write your name on it so you can take it home with you!
strTitle: Create your own Unique Souvenir: Japanese Calligraphy

strIntroduction: What's Kendo? Kendo is a modern expression of a traditional Japanese swordsmanship and martial arts that uses bamboo swords as an abstraction the Japanese Katana and wears kendo protective armor. strTitle: Practice Kendo, a Genuine Samurai experience in Tokyo

strIntroduction: The 2-hour duration of this unique Nihonga pigment painting workshop is ample even for beginners to produce a finished work of art. The classes are semi-private and special attention will be paid to your work. Of course, you can take the art you create home as a souvenir! I will provide the necessary materials so you don't have to worry about it. You will learn and use painting methods that are different from popular water colour or oil techniques. We'll use Japanese pigment, sumi ink, brushes, Washi paper, and an uchiwa fan. I can provide sample images for painting, but if you wish to make your own design, please bring sketches or photos. Nihonga Pigments: ground minerals mined from various places around the world. They are expensive than normal pigments For other times, please ask in advance. strIntroduction: Experience making and cooking Udon, one of the most loved traditional noodle in Japan! Many foreign travelers come to us daily to learn how to make handmade Udon and experience cooking real Japanese food in our Udon program. A Short History of Udon: Once upon a time, Kobo Daishi (The Grand Master who propagated Buddhist teachings) visited a farmer's house and he found one sick farmer. There were no doctors around, and the farmer did not have any food in the house. In the corner of the earthen floor of the farmer's house, Kobo found some wheat in a pot. He then made something noodle-like from the wheat, emulating the methods used in China where they ground wheat with a stone and kneaded it with Aya River water until it turned into dough. Daishi tried to eat the noodles with chopsticks but he could not retrieve them from the pan. Hence, he sourced for cut branches from a willow tree and weaved bamboo, creating something like a ladle. Daishi offered this very first noodle, the very first Udon to be made, to the farmer. The father ate it and recovered from his illness soon after.
strTitle: Experience Handmade Udon Noodle Making

strIntroduction: The tour starts at Shin-Fuji Station or Fuji Station or Shizuoka Station. Meeting around 9:00 am to 10:00 am will be fine. A chartered taxi will take us to the destination below: 6-hour itinerary: ● Tea Farm The view of green tea fields against Mt. Fuji is magnificent to see! You can learn about tea processing from a local tea grower and enjoy a taste of their tea. ● Omiya yoko-cho, side street (Fried noodle street) Enjoy famous local food which won the 1st prize in a semi-gourmet nationwide contest for two years in a row. ● Fujisan Hongu Sengen Shrine This shrine has been the head shrine for more than 1,300 Sengen shrines throughout Japan. This Sengen shrine was first built to pacify the eruption of Mt. Fuji in 806. Many successive emperors and powerful samurais and shogun families have shown profound reverence toward the shrine in the past. ● Fuji Takasago Sake Brewery Founded in 1831, Fuji Takasago is situated where Mt. Fuji’s pure groundwater is abundant for use and an ideal location for superb sake making. You can enjoy sampling good Japanese sake. 8-hour itinerary: Includes all of the above plus Shiraito Falls. ● Shiraito Fall is one of the sites of the Fujisan World Heritage. The spring water from Mt. Fuji can be seen as a great view of the fall with the width of 100m and the height of 25m.
strTitle: Take a Trip to the Outskirts of Mt Fuji in Shizuoka

strIntroduction: [Activity] With us you can have the opportunity to see Japan in an unique way from the sky enjoy it's natural landmarks and get to know the traditional Japanese lifestyle. The morning of the flight day, we will meet from 4:00 to 6:00 am depends on the season. If you can come by your own to the agreed meeting point, I will meet you there and we can go together to the flight site. If your group is under 3 people, I can pick you up at a hotel around Koga Station or the free room we arrange for the rest until early morning. Please let me know in advance. The day experience - standard plan: Before going to the flight site, we'll fly a pilot balloon to check the wind direction and speed and decide the launching site. This balloon is very important to determine the weather on the day and we'll watch it until it disappears in the sky. Arriving to the flight site, you can join the crew for unpacking and assembling the balloon. We will be airborne at around 7:00 to catch the sunrise depending on the season. We will be in the air for about 40-50 min (or 20-30 minutes per members in case of the standard plan). I'll take you to higher or lower levels so that you can enjoy the altitude as much as possible. The crew team will chase the balloon to its uncertain landing point.After landing, you can join the excitement of packing the balloon in a speedy way. We'll head to the warehouse to store the balloon and say good-bye to the crew team. You can fly all year round. However, in the event of strong wind or rain, the flight will be cancelled. The maximum number of participants is 6 people. The minimum number of participants for the standard plan is 2 people. If you are a single traveler, please see the special plans below. Special plans: 1. Single traveler: Give yourself a special treat and a present with this hot air balloon flight! Maximum number of participants: 1 2. Couple plan: Enjoy the romantic scenery from above together! Maximum number of participants: 2 3. Family plan: Safeness gears and special straps included. Specially targeted for families with kids. Maximum number of participants: 3 4. Surprise plan: Before arriving and assembling the balloon, we will give an eyemask and earplugs to your partner. When everything is ready, the surprise will be awesome! Maximum number of participants: 3 Note: If the total weight of all passengers is under 200 kg, it is possible to fit 4 people in the family and surprise plans. Free for children under 5-year-old. Special Options: 1. Flight ticket （¥1,000） We'll send an original flight ticket for some present to your precious person. The design is on our photo. 2. Drink in the sky (¥5,000) We'll provide some sparkling drinks in the sky. It's the best for cerebrating anniversary! 3. Flight movie by Gopro.(¥10,000) For unforgettable memories, We'll take flight movie from meeting to packing balloon. The data will be send by e-mail.
strTitle: See the Sunrise from a Hot Air Balloon just outside Tokyo!

strIntroduction: In this tour you will visit the famous Otaku places in Japan in 5 to 6 hours. I will pick you up at your hotel and will take you to the famous Otaku places in Tokyo. The tour will start at 10:00. First, we will go to Nakano, which is located west of Shinjuku. You will see many interesting second-hand goods (Japanese and foreign). Of course, you'll be able to buy new items too. Once we're done with the shopping in Nakano, we can have lunch or head straight to Akihabara. When we go to Akihabara, we will try to visit as many shops as you want. Of course, I will do the all translation for you, so you don`t have to worry about getting lost or anything. If you like, I will take to a maid cafe (I am not their biggest fan, but I will take you there anyway). At the end of the tour, we can finish in Akihabara, or I can take you back to your hotel. Enjoy one day shopping around Tokyo's most famous Otaku locations!
strTitle: Join an Otaku Shopping Tour!

strIntroduction: In this tour we will got to Fushimi area in south Kyoto to explore the origins of the local sake production! I will pick you up at Kyoto Station or at your hotel. You can choose how to go to Fushimi, by train or taxi. Train is the easiest and cheapest way, and it takes about 30 minutes to the destination. The ticket costs 260 JPY per person. If you would like to take a taxi, it costs about 3000 JPY. I am a licensed tour guide and an experienced traveler, so I will take you to Fushimi safely and entertain you. I'll introduce you to the culture of Japanese sake and you can take a look at the old tool of sake production. We will go to Gekkeikan Okura Kinenkan (a local sake museum). There you will see big barrels, steamers, containers, funnels, flasks, tanks and other items related to sake production. After seeing the museum you can taste three kinds of sake for free. And you can also buy your favorite sake. Nearby is the famous historical building, the Teradaya inn which dates back to the Meiji period. In addition, I will take you to Fushimi Inari Shrine as well! As an option, I can guide you through the historical heritage of Byodoin Temple too (please book the add-on option). Enjoy the trip with me and have great memory from your trip to Japan!
strTitle: 10% OFF Take a sake tour in Fushimi

strIntroduction: Tama river rafting is an exciting tour that all ages (6+) can have fun on throughout the season. Our tour is packed full of fun from start to the finish. When we are going down the river, we will stop for fun activities along the way, so you can fully enjoy your time on the river! We care about giving everyone a 100% fun tour all the time, so you will love the river as much as we do. Come enjoy Tama river rafting with us! If you planning to come by train, come to Oume station (JR Chuou line), and we will pick you up from the station. It will take about 1 hour and 30 minutes from JR Shinjuku station by train. The tour time is about 3 hours which includes getting ready, transport to the river, rafting, and chill-out time whilst checking out the photos from the tour. We are open everyday throughout the season. (4/19 - 10/25) Please contact us if you have any questions.
strTitle: River Rafting in Tama River

strIntroduction: This is a 4-hour bus tour, which you can watch Maiko show at Gion, enjoy delicious Kyoto cuisine, and even see the beautiful night view at the summit of Higashiyama! First of all, you can watch the Maiko show at Gion, which is one of the most traditional districts in Japan. Maikos are traditional performers who sing, dance, and play Japanese traditional instruments such as koto or shamisen for visitors. The way they dance is very fascinating and you may only experience this in Kyoto! Kyoto cuisine, which is also known as ""Kyo-ryori"", is the generic term of traditional Japanese cuisine made in Kyoto that includes Daikyo-ryori (grand banquet), Shojin-ryori (vegetarian dishes), Honzen-ryori (a high-grade Japanese meal served at once), Kaiseki (tea ceremony dishes), and Obanzai (side dishes featuring seasonal ingredients). With its sensitive tasting broth and beautiful appearance, eating Kyoto cuisine is one of the most popular activities in Japan. Higashiyama summit park is designated as a historical climate preservation district and you can see the night view from there on this tour. Needless to say, it is well-known as one of the best night views in Kyoto! If you join this tour, you can enjoy delicious Kyoto cuisine, watch a Maiko show and also see the beautiful night view. Don't miss this opportunity to fully enjoy Kyoto's traditional culture! This tour starts at 5pm at Kyoto station Karasumaru exit. You will receive multi-lingual audio guide during the experience. This tour is available everyday until September 30th, 2016. Notice: This tour will not be operated on April 2nd, 3rd, July 15th, 16th, 17th, 24th, August 16th)
strTitle: Enjoy Maiko Show & Kyoto Cuisine in Gion, Kyoto!

strIntroduction: Even if you haven't tried canoeing before, you can enjoy this tour which uses a Canadian canoe that is easy to balance and use. Glide effortlessly around the vast Lake Onuma with your guide leading you to areas with the best view and seasonal flowers in bloom on the lake. The 2hr session can fit easily into your packed schedule and provide a great memory for your family and friends! Don't miss this wonderful summer activity!
strTitle: 2hr Onuma Marsh Canoe Tour + Teatime! Beginners OK!

strIntroduction: Do you like to read Manga?? I guess a lot of people will say ''yes!'' ,as Japanese Manga are widely spread all over the world. But most of them have never tried to draw Manga even though they like it. Why don't you try drawing Japanese Manga as your experience or even hobby?? This Manga School , set in the pop culture center of Nakano, prepared the ''How to Draw Manga Course - English''. They are offering short programs that you can learn drawing Manga. Photo Credit: http://flic.kr/p/gju8qJ http://flic.kr/p/gjtF55 http://flic.kr/p/gjuUHe
strTitle: Learn How to Draw Japanese Manga

strIntroduction: Mt. Fuji is Japan's highest mountain and it's not surprising that the nearly perfectly shaped volcano has been worshiped as a sacred mountain and has experienced a big popularity among artists and general society throughout the centuries. Lake Ashi was formed in the caldera of Mt. Hakone after the volcano's last eruption 3,000 years ago. Today, the lake, with Mt. Fuji in the background, is the symbol of Hakone. The lake's shores are mostly undeveloped except for small towns in the east and north and a couple of lakeside resort hotels. The best views of the lake in combination with Mt. Fuji can be enjoyed from the sightseeing boat cruising the lake. The 1-day bus tour includes strolling around Odawara Castle Park, a delicious lunch, cruising on the Hakone Pirate Ship, and picking all-you-can-eat strawberries from a farm in Izu. You'll start in Shinjuku in the morning and come back to Shinjuku in the evening. Tours with less than 15 participants will be cancelled. If this is the case, those who have made a reservation will be informed of the cancellation by 4 days prior to the scheduled departure date. Schedule details: Period: March and April, 2017 Meeting place: Hotel Gracery Shinjuku Meeting time: 8:10 Return to Shinjuku: 18:00
strTitle: Enjoy a Hakone Cruise and Strawberry Picking in a day trip!

strIntroduction: Go snorkeling or scuba diving with a whale shark! Whale Sharks are actually the world's largest species of fish despite their name. Like whales, they enjoy a meal of plankton and small fish. They pose no harm to humans and are very friendly creatures. Whale sharks are the star idols of famous aquariums in Japan, including Churaumi Aquarium and the Osaka Aquarium. Why not take the opportunity to see one up close? All of your snorkeling or scuba diving equipment will be provided for you, along with safety lectures about swimming with these friendly creatures. In addition to swimming among the world's largest species of fish, you'll also enjoy the surrounding coral and other coral fish. You can choose between 3 different plans, outlined below! 1. New Plan Whale Shark & Blue Cave Snorkeling Ages: 6 - 59 years old Availability: April to October 31 Included: Equipment, Guide fee, Transportation, Insurance Schedule: Start Time: (1) 8:30 (2) 13:00 Meet at Ginowan Marina → Fill in the program application form, form check → Lecture about the equipment → Board the boat → Departure（arrive at the Blue Cave in 30 minutes) → Blue Cave snorkeling (around 40 minutes） → Back on boat（arrive at the place where whale sharks live in about 20 minutes) → Experience snorkeling with whale sharks（around 40 minutes) → Return to the port → Take a shower and change clothes at Ginowan Marina → Drop off or return to your hotel by yourself. Note: Between October 1 and October 30, 2015, there will be only one boat at 8:30 from Sunday to Thursday. 2. strIntroduction: Go to Tottori's famous desert near the sea and fly over the massive sand dunes which stretch for nearly 16 kilometers along the coastline! Choose between morning or afternoon paragliding course and soar in the sky! The panorama view over the dunes is fascinating! This activity is suitable for healthy people with no experience (even children older than 3 years old). A professional instructor will explain how to enjoy paragliding and how to use the rental equipment properly. Then you will try flying yourself in the sky. The view of the Sea of Japan and the vast desert will leave a lasting impression from your trip! Please note that the activity might be cancelled in case of bad weather. In summer it gets very hot at the sand dunes, so please prepare lots of water for drinking. Sunscreen and a hat are recommended. The half-day course begins at the following times and takes about 3 hours in total (with preparation and instructions): - 6:30 am - 9:30 am - 12:30 am - 15:30 am Enjoy the sky flight over Tottori's Sand Dunes!
strTitle: Paraglide over the sand dunes of Tottori's desert!

strIntroduction: Ishigaki island is located to the west of the main island of Okinawa and is a treasure trove of colorful coral reefs and tropical fishes. Snorkeling and diving is the best way to immerse yourself in this aquatic wonderland. You might even have a chance to see the Manta rays during the season! Take this opportunity to go snorkeling in one of Japan's most beautiful ocean to see colorful, lively fishes and coral reefs that sparkle when the sunlight shines through. Here is the basic daily schedule of the tour we have planned for you. 8:30AM Meet up at the dive shop. 9:00AM Depart to the snorkeling spot by boat. -1st Point: Coral reef (Half day course will go back to the shop 11:30) -2nd Point: Manta ray point 13:00PM Go back to the dive shop. -Lunch time. 15:00PM Go back to hotel. *Transportation service is available for the one day course. (Reservation required) *The half day course will not be going to the Manta point. Please join the one day course if you wish to see Manta rays.
strTitle: Go Snorkeling with Emerald Ocean! - in Ishigaki Island

If so, come join this event where you can become a Samurai for a day! After you wear your Samurai costume, you will learn some general knowledge about the Samurai and the Samurai Kembu. You will also learn how to use the Japanese sword. If you wish, you can also experience how to use the folding fan! There will be an one hour stage show by our masters. You can take photos with our masters after their show! strTitle: Enjoy Becoming a Samurai in Kyoto

strIntroduction: This is a 8-hour tour around the most famous locations of Kyoto, Japan's ancient capital. Discover all the best treasures of the glorious city of emperors and traditions together with a very experienced and friendly guide. Following the pick-up at your hotel, we will go directly to the Kinkakuji Temple (the Golden Pavilion). The beautiful garden complex is one of the best in Japan. It's an excellent example of medieval Japanese garden design. The harmonious relationship between architecture and landscape were greatly emphasized and celebrated during that period, and you will still see this today in the beautiful reflection of the Golden Pavilion in the pond's still water surface. Next, we will visit Kiyomizu Temple. The original temple was founded in 798. Since Kiyomizu Temple's terrace stands 13 meters high, you can get a full panorama view of Kyoto city from here. Moreover, Kiyomizu means "pure water" in Japanese. It is said that water from the temple's spring can purify your soul and make your wishes come true. Stroll along the souvenir shops of the famous scenic Sannenzaka Hill, where you can have a traditional Japanese lunch. After lunch, we will go to Fushimi Inari Shrine. At this shrine, you will first see a pair of stone foxes. Because the tail of a fox resembles the ears of the rice plant, the fox was believed to be the messenger of the gods. Moreover, this shrine was worshiped as the patron of business by many merchants and manufacturers. There are roughly 10,000 "torii" or sacred shrine gates. Each of them is donated by believers. You will also walk at Nishiki Market. This market was founded about 1,300 years ago and is still well-known as "Kitchen of Kyoto". Moreover, you can eat around. This tour will be your most memorable experience of traditional Japan!
strTitle: Discover the most memorable treasures of Kyoto

strIntroduction: Enjoy your day by cycling around Tokyo with an English-speaking tour guide departing from Toranomon Hills! Explore some areas of Tokyo by choosing either one of the two available courses: 1. Traditional Tokyo Ride a bicycle from Toranomon Hills and explore Tokyo's traditional districts such as Hibiya Park, the Imperial Palace, Tsukiji Market, Ginza and Nihonbashi! 2. Bay Area cycle and cruise tour Ride a bicycle from Toranomon Hills and explore Tokyo's Bay Area all the way to Odaiba from where we'll return by a boat! Both programs start from Toranomon Hills, which is 5 minutes walking from Toranomon Station. The Traditional Tokyo tour starts at 9:00 am, while the Bay Area tour starts at 15:30 pm. The fee includes rent fee for the bicycle and lunch. Our guide will be waiting for you at the lobby in front of the Family Mart Convenience Store on the 3rd floor of the building. This tour is only available upon reservation, so we recommend you to use our reservation service to reserve this tour!
strTitle: Enjoy One Day Cycling Tour From Toranomon Hills in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: At the very core of Japanese people's philosophy lies Shintoism, a belief that gods exist and can be found in all natural materials in this world (mountains, rivers, lightning, wind, waves, trees, rocks). We want to bring you into the centre of this pristine nature in Keihoku to enjoy the spectacular scenery and appreciate the harmonious relationship between humans and nature. In this tour, we visit a waterfall deep in the forest, as well as spend time in the tranquil Joshokoji temple. We will also bring you to a beautiful village called Miyama where you can see thatched houses and catch a beautiful panoramic view of Kyoto. Itinerary 9:30 You will take a bus from Kyoto station to Shuzan '周山' by yourself 11:00 Host will pick you up at Shuzan 11:00-17:30 we will tour the sightseeing spots in Shuzan (Joshokuji Temple, Miyama and others) 17:40 You will take a bus from Shuzan to Kyoto station by yourself 19:00 Back to Kyoto station
strTitle: Trek in Nature's Beauty & Visit a Peaceful Temple Garden

strIntroduction: One of the best things about this tour is that it is VERY FLEXIBLE as it will be designed specifically for your needs. Upon confirming your booking, I will send an email with some suggested itineraries as well as a list of my own personal highlights and favourites. Browse through at your leisure and email me a few days before your tour with any requests you have. One idea of a common 1 day itinerary: HEIAN JINGU: Here we will stroll the classic Chinese style garden and talk about the early days of life in the court filled with poetry and the smell of incense and get a taste of life in the ancient capital which was originally named Heian “capital of peace and tranquillity” GINKAKUJI TEMPLE: Ginkakuji or the Silver Pavilion was built by a shogun who reigned during the birth of Higashiyama culture, a time when the tea ceremony and the philosophy of “wabi-sabi” or beauty in imperfection was born. Before death this shogun became a Zen priest and his villa was turned into a Zen temple. NANZEN-Ji: A beautiful temple complex with an amazing rock garden, Nanzen-Ji is one of the important Zen temples in Kyoto complete with a famous rock garden. It also has an expansive ground with plenty of sub-temples and gardens surrounding the area. A great place to soak up the atmosphere without all the crowds. GION: This ancient entertainment district has a fantastic atmosphere and was a symbol of the rise of the merchant class in the 17th century. Just before dinner you will sometimes see "geisha" and "maiko" running off to a dinner appointment in their wooden slippers. A few hours later you will see the modern equivalent hostesses clipping along on high heels to classy lounge bars to entertain the well-to-do. An interesting glimpse into the form of night entertainment traditionally referred to as the water trade or "mizu shobai". We can use a variety of transport including taxis depending on what is the most convenient but not to worry as your guide will whisk you from place to place. The busy season is upon us so make sure to enquire now if you are interested and I can hold the date for you. Looking forward to showing you around this splendid city.
strTitle: Kyoto Fun: Personalised Private Tour

strIntroduction: The shamisen is a traditional 3-string Japanese instrument similar to a banjo and traditionally used to accompany Japanese Minyou, or folk music. There are, however, varying styles of playing the shamisen, including the up-tempo and percussive Tsugaru style of the Tsugaru region in Northern Japan. In recent years, Tsugaru Shamisen has become popularized by the soulful and bombastic style of the Yoshida Brothers, whose playing have turned the folk instrument into a stage performance. Although it may seem daunting to learn, anyone can learn to play simple songs like the popular Japanese folksong "Sakura Sakura" or even up-tempo pieces on the shamisen quickly.
strTitle: Learn to Play the Shamisen and Koto

strIntroduction: Tokyo has a lot of attractive spots to look around so it's not easy to make a priority where to visit first and to plan put routes. That's why this half day sightseeing tour that takes you to the best places of Tokyo is a great option for any traveler. Starting from the morning with a pick-up from designated Hotels then visiting popular spots with an English guide. The first stop is Tokyo Tower the long-time famous symbol of the city. The tower has 2 different observation decks that show off different scenery an its magnificent panoramic view is really worth seeing. There are also lots of exciting things there such as looking down from the transparent wide window on the deck, going to the top of 600 steps, visiting a power spot of the towering shrine, many of these have long queues, so visiting them in the morning is the wise plan and is a highlight of this tour. After that, the tour visits Meiji Shrine which is well known as one of Japan's most popular shrines and has a forest of approximately 100,000 trees that were donated from regions across the entire country for the goal of making a natural forest within Tokyo's busy city. Among the trees there is a wide range of nature including animals such as racoons, halcyon, and others that are rare to see in the middle of the city. The main shrine building stands in quiet solemnity and such sights are gaining in popularity especially among young ladies. After the tranquil forest the tour moves to the Imperial Palace where you can see Akasaka State Guest House that is a remaining example of a Meiji-era structure in the baroque architectural style famous for being designated as a National Treasure of Japan. Then, the National Diet Building, which is an impressive building. At the Imperial Palace East Garden, there are the remains of the former castle tower and a beautiful and elegant Japanese garden where you can enjoy its peaceful, serene beauty. After the Imperial Palace, the tour will end at Ginza where both the latest fashion trends and old traditions can be seen and is famous for its high brand shops from all over the world. The one-day tour schedule is as follows: 07:30- 09:00 Pick up at designated Hotels 08:45 Ana Intercontinental Tokyo 08:30 Celestine Hotel 08:55 Conrad Tokyo 08:55 Courtyard Marriott Ginza Tobu Hotel Tokyo Tower (30 minutes) Meiji Shrine (40 minutes) Akasaka Guest House (Drive by) National Diet Building (Drive by) Imperial Palace East Garden (40 minutes) Ginza Shopping District (Drive Through) 13:00 Tour ends in Ginza ※Please choose pickup points from the following list: 08:45 Ana Intercontinental Tokyo 08:30 Celestine Hotel 08:55 Conrad Tokyo 08:55 Courtyard Marriott Ginza Tobu Hotel 09:00 Daiichi Hotel Annex 09:00 Daiichi Hotel Tokyo 08:50 Excel Hotel Tokyu Akasaka 08:35 Grand Hyatt Tokyo 08:05 Grand Prince Hotel New Takanawa 08:10 Hilton Tokyo 08:10 Hotel Grand Palace 07:40 Hotel Metropolitan (Ikebukuro) 08:45 Hotel New Otani 08:45 Hotel Okura Tokyo 08:15 Hyatt Regency Tokyo 08:55 Imperial Hotel Tokyo 08:40 Intercontinental Tokyo Bay 08:20 Keio Plaza Hotel Tokyo 08:40 Mandarin Oriental Tokyo 08:40 Marunouchi Hotel 08:50 Mercure Hotel Ginza Tokyo 08:00 Odakyu Hotel Century Southern Tower 08:45 Palace Hotel Tokyo 08:55 Park Hotel Tokyo 08:30 Park Hyatt Tokyo 08:30 Royal Park (Near Tokyo City Air Terminal 08:55 Royal Park Shiodome Tower 08:15 Sheraton Miyako Hotel Tokyo 08:50 Shiba Park Hotel 08:00 Shinagawa Prince Hotel 08:00 Shinjuku Prince Hotel 08:25 Shinjuku Washington Hotel 07:30 Sunshine City Prince Hotel 08:50 The Capitol Hotel Tokyu 08:25 The New Sanno Hotel 08:40 The Prince Park Tower Tokyo 08:40 The Rits Carlton Tokyo 08:00 Tokyo Dome Hotel 08:45 Tokyo Prince Hotel
strTitle: Enjoy Half-Day Tour of Best Tokyo Spots with English Guide!

strIntroduction: I will guide you around Tokyo's most famous spot places during this one day trip. Following a pick-up at your hotel, we will buy a "One Day Pass" ticket at a subway station for only 1000 JPY (not included in the price of this tour). We will visit Tukiji fish market where we will have breakfast. Then to Tokyo Skytree, a 634-meter-high tower that offers commanding views over Tokyo. Then, we will move to Sensoji, an old temple founded in 628 AD in Asakusa, one of Tokyo’s favorite entertainment districts, where you can have a delicious sushi lunch. After lunch we will stroll through the inner gardens of the Imperial Palace East Garden, built over the the original site of the Edo Castle, and admire the moats, lawns, and stunning colors of the Japanese trees. We will take the subway and head for Meiji Jingu Shrine, dedicated to Emperor Meiji. You will see many worshipers there. Finally, we will move to the final destination - the Ginza shopping district, known for its boutique sores and major shops of famous designer brands. The tour ends here, so you can carry on shopping on your own, or relax in one of Ginza’s luxury restaurants or trendy coffee shops.
strTitle: Take a one-day trip around the best spots in Tokyo

strIntroduction: In this grand tour, you’ll be whisked away to the best high spots of Tokyo!! A full day tour will help you discover the many different sides of this amazing city! All the places are highly recommended places to visit while you are in Tokyo. You can go to these popular places with English guides who are very knowledgeable and happy to answer your questions! They can even help you learn a bit of Japanese. The tour kicks off with panoramic views from Tokyo Tower, which is a symbolic figure of Tokyo. If you are lucky, you’ll be able to see Mt. Fuji!! Then you are going to visit traditional Japanese buildings, such as Sensoji Temple, Meiji Shrine, and the Imperial Palace! All these places will take you back to the old Japan. Along the street to Sensoji, you will enjoy shopping through Nakamise. After that, you’ll be joining the cruise down from Sumida River. In spring, cherry blossoms are in bloom along the river and the scenery is amazing. Also, you will be walking through Tokyo and experience the scenic vista! You can also look forward to lunch! You will have an authentic Japanese lunch with Tempura, Yakitori and other Japanese cuisines. Feel the taste of the old to the new Tokyo! All these amazing spots with this price well make for a grand experience. You won’t regret it.
strTitle: Grand Tour of Tokyo Highlights with English Guide, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Do you like sushi and tempura? Do you know that Japanese cuisine is much richer? You can learn all of that if you come to my kitchen near Ginza and learn to cook healthy Japanese meals prepared by local Japanese mothers. You will be able to cook the dishes when you go back to your home country. We are a group of well-trained English speaking mothers. You will have fun in our Japanese home cooking class. Here are the details of this activity: Our staff will meet you at Toyosu Station at 10:30 am. From there it’s about 12-minute walk to our kitchen. Below is our year-round menu. If your group is more than 3 people, this activity will be private and we will be happy to customize the menu according to your requests. Please feel free to ask when you make a booking. 1) Steamed rice and pickles / Miso soup / Dashimaki-tamago (Japanese-style omelette) Karashiae or goma-ae: Lightly boiled seasonal green vegetables with Japanese mustard sauce or sesame sauce Yaki-zakana: Grilled fish 2) Curry-rice or omu-rice or hayashi-rice (choose one) / Green salad or goma-ae 3) Steamed rice and pickles / Miso soup/ Tonkatsu (breaded pork cutlet) / Cooked vegetables as a side dish 4) Steamed rice and pickles / Miso soup/ Nikujaga (meat stew) / Cooked vegetables as a side dish 5) Sushi for a party Do-it-yourself sushi rolls / sushi in a cup / sushi-balls / sushi cakes These are easy enough even for kids to make. (Please note that you will be asked to pay additional 1000 JPY for the last option, menu number 5) Besides those menus, we prepare other special dishes using seasonal ingredients. For example, takenoko gohan (rice cooked with Bamboo shoots) in spring and green soy beans or Japanese ginger salad in summer. Autumn specials will include takikomi gohan (sort of a Japanese-style pilaf), kuri-gohan (chestnut rice), chawan-mushi, and grilled fish. The winter special will be nabe (a hot pot) cooked on the table.The hot pot is popular as a winter family meal not only because it makes you warm, but also because it has a variety of ingredients such as seafood, meat, tofu, mushrooms, and vegetables. In our class, you will also learn how to make steamed rice in a pan (not an electric rice cooker). Of course, you will learn how to make dashi soup stock in a traditional way. So, let’s start cooking! After cooking, you will enjoy the lunch you made and chat with us!
strTitle: Learn healthy cooking from a Japanese mother near Ginza

strIntroduction: Visit one of famous shopping street (Musashikoyama: 12 minutes from Shibuya, 20 minutes from Shinjuku by train) in Tokyo and enter variety of stores such as drug stores, supermarkets, convenience stores, and small specialized stores. 15:00: Meet at your hotel 16:00: Move to Musashikoyama shopping street 16:00-18:00: Stroll the shopping street 19:00: Go back to your hotel Japanese young women like to visit drug stores to look around and find something new and interesting to buy, while young men like to visit convenient stores 2 times per day and buy their lunch/dinner, snacks, drinks while they pay their bill, withdraw money and so on. On the other hand, older women like to go shopping 4-5 times per week and they are looking for something good for their family, while older men like to visit Pachinko parlors (Game center) to enjoy themselves. Pachinko and Karaoke are Japanese favorite types of entertainment and you can find many of those on the shopping street. You can see and feel the real life of Japanese people and I can explain their habits and attitude since I have been working at a FMCG (Fast Moving Consumer Goods) multi-national company for almost 30 years and was involved in market research. You can find a variety of take-out foods and those are Japanese favorite foods for everyday life. Japanese like to drink after work, as one communication method with their co-workers and there are so many casual drinking restaurant in the area.
strTitle: Shopping tour in Tokyo to understand Japanese consumers

strIntroduction: To the Japanese, a ninja is neither a spy nor an assassin. The ninja is a person who places a sword on his/her heart to control and discipline him/herself. Ninjas seek to maintain "balance" or peace of mind in life to survive. Our ancestors came to Tokyo over 400 years ago, following a feudal lord named Tokugawa Ieyasu, who founded the Tokugawa Shogunate in 1603. As the Shibatas had loyal ninjas, our ancestors could serve the government as heads of "Onmitsu" ninjas. If you check about your host's great grandfather, Shibata Takenaka, you can see our linage. As our ancestors worked for Tokugawa Shogunate for 265years, you can find some historical documents in libraries and the ministry of foreign affairs, which is rather unique, as most of ninja histories have been kept secret. In our clan we have crafted our weapons for over 400 years. You'll see some of the weapons hand-crafted by your host(ess) and her father. In your session, you will train yourself learning three ninja techniques our novices learn in his/her first class. The activity includes: 1. Ninja experience meditation 2. Change to a ninja outfit 3. Practice Ninja Stars 4 Practice Blowgun 5. Learn Kujikiri (well-wishing) technique 6. Photo-taking time About Meditation: The art of ninjutsu is more than learning the physical skills of the martial arts. It is also about finding your inner self through physical conditioning, meditation, and discipline. With the practice of meditation one develops key elements of increased awareness and detachment while increasing his/her sense of inner peace. It is through meditation that ninjas learn how to reach the "ku" (no-self, void), and to control the energy called "ki" which is the essential life force existing in all things in the universe. In meditation a ninja seeks to get to the "ku no kyochi" (state of no-self) by integrating his/her body and mind. This state of mind gives a ninja the power to block out everything except the task at hand by using a sense of extreme calm and enhanced concentration. About Kujikiri: Kujikiri is a series of nine symbolic hand gestures. It invokes the spiritual and mental strength of an individual. The hand signs are believed to be able to channel energy. The hand signs were taken from the practices of the early Buddhists. They are used to build confidence and strength in the practitioner. They are also believed to enhance one's senses of danger and enable one to foresee death. About weapons: Get a chance to view some of the famous weapons made by our master weapon-smith. *If your requested starting time is after 8pm, or between 6am and 9am, please pay for the Ninjas' overnight stay fee 2000 yen a person. You can make the payment by purchasing the "[Add-on] Ninja Overnight Stay Fee" in addition to your experience fee.
strTitle: Be a Ninja: Learn Three Basic Techniques

strIntroduction: The cuisine of Okinawa is famous for the variety that is offers. Okinawa people are famous for Longevity. People say the secret of long life is their traditional cuisine. The characteristics of Okinawa cuisine are mainly used pigs and kelp broth, bonito. Use of the local ingredients such as fresh vegetable and cook different of methods created a spectacular cuisine in Okinawa. In this activity, You can choose 1 of 3 different dishes as follows with a specialty Okinawa vegetable named GOYA. Cook and Try! - Goya Champlung (Scramble egg and Goya, meat) - Goya Salad (Salad made with Goya) - Goya squash (Fresh Juice made with Goya) Learn Okinawa homemade cooking and you can enjoy your favorite Okinawa dishes at home!
strTitle: Cooking Experience Okinawa Cuisine with GOYA

strIntroduction: This is a tour around the World Heritage Mt. Fuji, a source of art for Japanese engravers such as Hokusai or Hiroshige, who are widely known, and many other artists who were inspired by its beautiful shape that can be seen from hundreds of kilometers away. In this tour I will take you to the best spots from where Mt. Fuji can beautifully be seen and end the day in a relaxing hot spring. ※If you are hesitant bathing with other people tell me so, I will arrange to have more sight seeing. We will pick you up at your accommodation and depart at 8:30 am. The tour will start from one of the most stunning view points of Mt. Fuji famous for its five-storied pagoda at Arakurasengen Park. We will move to see the pastoral landscape of Oshino Hakkai with old style Japanese houses and a total of eight ponds formed from the beautiful groundwater of Mt. Fuji. The name “Hakkai” meaning eight seas actually represents the ponds that were originally used for cold showering for the pilgrims in the Edo era. We will be taking lunch at a local restaurant. After a 1-hour drive to reach the caldera Lake Ashi, we will go to the top of the 1350-meter high Hakone Mountain by ropeway. Here again the view from the lake and from the top of the mountain are astonishing. We will have a short tea break at an old traditional tea house on the side of an old road that connected Tokyo and Kyoto, called the Tokaido (road of the east sea). The last activity will be refreshing yourself at a modern designed hot spring that I recommend. ※All viewpoints are chosen and been supervised by Mr. Rocky Tanaka, the only professional Mt. Fuji photographer. The picture used on top of the page is one of his work. You can check his works online. Fore more tour photos please also check my instagram https://www.instagram.com/tyj0520/
strTitle: See Mt Fuji's stunning view points and experience hot spring

strIntroduction: The two ancient cities, Kyoto and Nara are located far from each other, but it is possible to travel around the famous sightseeing spots in both of these cities in one day. This tour makes it possible for you to visit both of the cities without having the feeling of being rushed. This tour will cover many major tourist spots in Kyoto and Nara in one day! Kyoto was Japan’s capital for over 1,000 years, and the historical scents of Japan still remain. Kyoto has a stunning collection of UNESCO World Heritage sites and also a geisha district. The temples and traditions are outstanding, but the food is also exquisite! Nara is also one of Japan's ancient cities, with many historical sites, located less than one hour from Kyoto. Japan’s first permanent capital was established in the year 710 at Heijo, which has now become Nara. Since it was the first permanent capital, Nara remains as a city with many historical treasures, including the oldest and largest temples in Japan. In this tour, you will visit places in Kyoto and Nara in one day! A local guide will show you around safely, while presenting you with important and interesting information about the historical sites and about the city in general. Why we love it: - Don't have enough time to travel around? No worries! Visit famous sightseeing sites in one day! - You do not worry about changing trains or buses as you travel around Kyoto and Nara since you will get around with your guide! - Take a tour with a knowledgeable English-speaking local guide with years of experience. -Strap on your adventurous spirit and immerse yourself in Kyoto and Nara Regarding itineraries, You can talk to our guide to make the best plan based on your requests since it's a customizable tour. Through the tour,you will be able to visit 3-4 sites in total in Kyoto and Nara. Since this is a one day trip, you can do other activities on the next day! If you would like to visit highlights of Kyoto and Nara in one day, exploring not only Kyoto but also Nara, join our tour and enjoy your stay in Japan! Don’t miss this opportunity! ※Please note that the host may not be able to pick you up at your hotel depending on the location of your hotel even if you book a hotel pick up option. In that case,we will refund for what you paid for the hotel pick up option. Please let us know where you are going to stay when you make a booking. ※Transportation will be using public transportation, such as trains and buses. Photos by: -https://flic.kr/p/mDaR4z -https://flic.kr/p/7w3z1c -https://flic.kr/p/e9CCtB -https://flic.kr/p/5D42hM -https://flic.kr/p/ajZtMR -https://flic.kr/p/auTa3c https://flic.kr/p/g9U5yx
strTitle: Explore the historical cities, Kyoto and Nara in 1 day!

strIntroduction: This tour will take you to see the most important attractions of Nagano City and the Yamanouchi area. You will take a scenic route to see the cutest monkeys in the world and afterwards spend time at the temple of Zenkoji and the bustling Nakamise shopping street, as well as having sake tasting experience at the end. Your guide will meet you at Nagano Station at 8:45 am and will lead you to the Yamanouchi region here you get to meet the Japanese snow monkeys. These monkeys are world-famous for their rare habit of bathing in hot springs during winter. When at the Park, the snow monkeys will let you get really close to them for some great photo opportunities. After saying goodbye to the snow monkeys take a stroll along a tranquil forest trail to the lunch cafe. After a delicious lunch you will get back on the road and head to the Zenko-ji Temple. The temple of Zenkoji is famous for holding the first Buddhist statue brought to Japan. This has made the temple an important pilgrimage site with people coming from all over Japan to pray for their place in Buddhist heaven. Zenkoji Temple has a special energy, and welcomes people of all faiths and religions. The temple grounds have many hidden gems to explore, such as the dark tunnel which runs under the temple. Here you can allegedly gain enlightenment if you find the "Key To Paradise". After exploring Zenko-ji Temple, the guide will take you to one of Nagano's most historic sake breweries where you get the opportunity to try several types of sake. Nagano is one of the regions in Japan with a very active production of sake. Clean spring water in combination with a climate suitable for rice production creates the optimal environment for high quality sake. You can find yourself a good souvenir at Nagano's beloved sake brewery. You will be taken back to Nagano Station where the tour concludes at 17:00. Tour Itinerary: 08:45 Meet up at Nagano Station under the East Exit information board opposite of the Shinkansen exit. 10:00 Welcome to the Snow Monkey area! Walk for 30 minutes along a forest trail to the Snow Monkey Park where you get to enjoy the wild monkeys playing around. 12:15 Have delicious lunch nearby the Snow Monkey Park! 13:00 Leave the lunch restaurant and get taken to the historically important Zenko-ji Temple. 14:15 See the sights of the Zenko-ji Temple and learn of the interesting facts. Enjoy up to 30 minutes of shopping on Nakamise Street. 16:00 Visit a sake brewery and enjoy tasting different types of sake! 16:45 Get on the bus and arrive back to Nagano station by 17:00.
strTitle: 1-Day Tour in Nagano: Snow Monkeys, Zenkoji Temple and Sake

strIntroduction: This is a private tour for you. So you don't need to care about other customers. The tour time is 2.5- 4 hours. strIntroduction: There are several places in downtown Fukuoka where you can enjoy yatai - Food stalls for various dishes. These places are Nakasu, Tenjin, and Nagahama area. You can choose 1 area from the above and we will first stroll around the area and then I'll recommended 2 yatai stalls to eat local food according to your taste. Usually yatai stalls open from around 5 or 6 pm until 1 or 2 am. The tour will start from around that time, and end after around 4 hours. We can meet at your hotel, shopping store, or subway Tenjin Station. If you are interested in learning Japanese, I will teach you how to order food in Japanese at the yatai. This is a private tour. I would like to meet many people from various countries and have cultural exchange with them!
strTitle: Take a Fukuoka Yatai Tour and Taste the Best Local Food

strIntroduction: Ever since the Edo period for over 400 years, “buyo”, a type of traditional dance in Japan, has existed thanks to people who can still dance this traditional art and successfully pass it on. "Buyo" involves dancers stamping their feet and making huge hand/body gestures while twisting and turning to music that can be best described as traditional pop music. In this activity, you’ll... • Watch a “buyo” performance by a successor of this tradition with an interpreter who will give you English explanations. With explanations, you will fully experience and enjoy the essence of “buyo”. When you visit Japan, come and see an exceptional and traditional Japanese performance.
strTitle: Watch a Japanese “Buyo” (Dance) Performance

strIntroduction: Have you ever seen food samples? Japan has become adept at making artificial food called "Sanplu". The term “Sanplu” itself comes from the word "Sample" in English. In this activity we will: - Visit a “Sanplu” shop in Kappabashi between Asakusa and Ueno. There are so many "Sanplu" shops to visit here. You will be mesmerized at how amazing these stores are! - Make your own "Sanplu". - If you find a “Sanplu” you like, you can buy it as well!! But don't forget, you can’t eat it!
strTitle: Make Your Own Plastic Food Models: Japanese Sample

strIntroduction: Reiki originates from Japan and is a popular hands-on-healing that is well known globally. A treatment feels like a wonderful glowing radiance that flows through and around you. Reiki treats the whole person including body, emotions, mind and spirit creating many beneficial effects that include relaxation and feelings of peace, security and well being. Some of the Health Benefits from Reiki ★ Complete relaxation ★ Release of stress and anxiety ★ Positive emotional states ★ A release of old blocked emotions ★ Pain relief ★ A strengthened immune system ★ Open your intuitive centers ★ Enhance learning ★ Eliminate emotional, physical and mental stress ★ Help overcome past trauma A Reiki healing is very simply performed. The Reiki Practitioner (healer) serves as a channel by placing her hands upon you for the energy to flow. The client remains fully clothed and the session can take place with the client lying down. A Reiki treatment feels like a wonderful glowing radiance that flows through and around you. The energy flows wherever it is required and can normally be felt as a warm sensation or tingling in the body. Reiki treats the whole person including body, emotions, mind and spirit creating many beneficial effects that include relaxation and feelings of peace, security and well being. Receiving Reiki is a very relaxing and soothing experience. Sessions usually last approximately one hour.
strTitle: Reiki Healing Sessions
